history.content: The pre-reqs that the website are referring to are just CS61A, CS61B, and CS70. You're fine.

children.subject: In general, all classes required for a major needs to be taken for a letter grade, so I think you would need to find some alternative to Math 1B for a grade somehow.

OP here. I emailed a CS adviser and got this response, just wanted to publicly post it for future reference in case anyone else was going through the same thing: 

All courses used towards major requirements need to be taken for a letter grade (lower and upper division courses). However, you do have a couple of options:
  1. Submit an exceptional request. 
    • Contact the instructor of the course to ask for the letter grade you would have gotten if you hadn't change your grading option. Then submit that information to the exceptions committee for review. There are no guarantees that they will approve your request.
  3. Retake the course or complete the credit through credit by examination
    • It could be the case that your exceptional request will be denied and the committee can suggest that you retake the course for a letter grade or complete the credit by examination through the math department. If you have to retake the course, check with L&S advising to make sure there wont be any problems.
Please let me know if you have any other questions or concerns.

history.content:
Rising sophomore that's currently freaking out here. 

Fall 2018 was my first semester at Cal, and I was doing horribly in Math 1B, so I P/NP'd it and ended up with a P.  I understand that Math 1B is a major requirement for CS, so I'm taking it this summer at CC, and will additionally be taking Math 53 at Cal in the fall. 

I have earned an A- in 61A and plan on taking 61B with Hilfinger this fall. 

After reading the L&S CS Major FAQ , I saw this:

 

Is "prereq" referring to all of the lower division CS requirements, or just 61AB + 70? Have I made myself ineligible for the CS major because I decided to P/NP Math 1B and take it at CC?

If this the case I would be crushed since I worked so hard to do well in 61A :((.

Could someone please clear things up for me? Thank you so much. 

- a very anxious student
history.subject: Have I been disqualified from the CS major?
